primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God enters the darkness of human sin and cosmic chaos through the death of Christ to execute judgment and reclaim the world from the powers of evil.

tekstueel_bewijs: God is acting here to pronounce sentence upon the wickedness of the world.
God the Son giving himself for the salvation of the world.
The One who brought it [nature] into existence.

object.identificatie: Salvation of the world and the defeat of the powers of darkness.
tekstueel_bewijs: salvation of the world that he has made
the meaning of the Cross and the purpose of God
the Lord reveals himself as the Way, the Truth, and the Life

ontvanger.identificatie: The World / The Household of God
tekstueel_bewijs: judgment to begin with the household of God
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is the Receiver of the action, called to witness the Subject's work.

helper.identificatie: The Word and Sacraments / The Prophets
tekstueel_bewijs: makes himself known in Word and Sacrament
The prophets of old called the people... the eclipse summons us
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, not merely a helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicitly the power making the Word known in the congregation.

tegenstander.identificatie: Satan / Chaos / Sin / The Powers of Death
tekstueel_bewijs: the powers of evil in the world are let loose
Satan is unleashed against the only-begotten Son of God
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely human bad habits but ontological 'chaos' and a personal 'Satan' that requires a divine Subject to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the church to the divine act: Repentance and confession.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believing Community
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human response is framed as a 'proper part' or 'privilege' following the objective cosmic event of the Cross.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God is acting here to pronounce sentence.
The creation goes into mourning for its Maker.
God the Son giving himself for the salvation of the world.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We are being invited to trust.
We must go back into the Hebrew Bible.

voorbeelden: It is our proper part... to think of our own disobedience.
What is really challenging is to understand.
In order to understand... we must go back into the Hebrew Bible.
The powers of death have done their worst.
The Almighty Creator God himself... giving himself.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' of God versus the 'Power' of darkness. The human 'Devoir' (duty) is secondary to the divine 'Pouvoir' (ability) to save.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S1 (Creation) to S2 (Judgment/Darkness) to reveal that S2 is the location where God performs S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The darkness is not the absence of God but the 'presence in human form of the Almighty Creator' taking the judgment.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; darkness is treated as a cosmic reality, not a metaphor.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor in the cosmic drama. Human response is a reaction to a finished divine work.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Call to repentance as a task
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: It is our proper part... to think of our own disobedience.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as active Subject of salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God himself is acting here to pronounce sentence upon the wickedness of the world.
Satan is unleashed against the only-begotten Son of God.

exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: This is not merely the death of an exemplary man... it is the Almighty Creator God.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Awe and relief; the burden of the cosmic battle is on Christ.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from cosmic sign to human repentance is well-integrated via the concept of 'judgment'.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'scientific impossibility' and 'essential truth' is acknowledged but bypassed for semiotic depth.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: In this final onslaught of Satan... we learn what is the outermost boundary and limit of the power of sin.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the objective work of the Son rather than the subjective work of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is linked to the undoing of creation (chaos).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's agency against cosmic darkness. The hearer is a witness/receiver.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Savoir (knowing the OT background).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current focus on Pouvoir (God's power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Link the 'Pouvoir' of the Cross more explicitly to the 'Pouvoir' of the believer's daily life.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's act) correctly precedes and grounds Ethics (Repentance).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that avoids the trap of making the Cross a mere moral example.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of newsmagazines as a hook, Greimas shows the underlying 'Subject' remains God despite the modern opening.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the darkness; Greimas explains that the darkness functions as an 'Opponent' that validates the 'Subject's' power.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-switch'—moving from the 'Jesus Seminar' (human subjects) to 'The Creator' (divine subject).

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully maintains God as the subject of the active verbs in the most critical soteriological moments.
